intro: Stenogyne angustifolia var. hillebrandii, commonly known as the Hillebrand's narrowleaf stenogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as mesic forests and rocky areas. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish in color, and it produces small, berry-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
